meanings.definition: To fill with air or gas, causing to expand
meanings.sent1: I used a pump to inflate the balloon for the party.
meanings.sent2: The tire shop will inflate your car tires to the recommended pressure.
meanings.sent3: Trying to inflate a balloon by blowing really hard can be quite comical.
meanings.sent4: Her ego seemed to inflate like a balloon with every compliment she received.
meanings.sent5: The bouncy castle began to inflate, making it ready for the children to play.

meanings.definition: To increase in size or amount
meanings.sent1: The company plans to inflate their profits by expanding into new markets.
meanings.sent2: During winter, some animals inflate their bodies to stay warm.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the alien invasion started to inflate beyond belief.
meanings.sent4: His excitement seemed to inflate to new heights as the concert date approached.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon began to inflate slowly, ready for takeoff.

meanings.sent1: She tends to inflate her achievements to impress others.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman's story started to inflate as he retold it to his friends.
meanings.sent3: His excuse for being late was so inflated that no one believed him.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises seemed to inflate more and more as the election neared.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement tried to inflate the benefits of the product, making it seem too good to be true.
